intro: Elatostema busseanum, commonly known as the dwarf snowflake, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its foliage is often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Elatostema busseanum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
